comment.author: 69755091@N07
comment._content:
Name: WILLIAMS, WALTER 
Initials: W 
Nationality: United Kingdom 
Rank: Lance Corporal 
Regiment/Service: South Wales Borderers 
Unit Text: 11th Bn. 
Date of Death: 10/07/1916 
Service No: 22554 
Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead 
Grave/Memorial Reference: Pier and Face 4 A. 
Memorial: THIEPVAL MEMORIAL 
Born: Birkdale, Lancashire
Enlisted: Liverpool
Medal Index Card shows he arrived in France on the 4th December 1915.

comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: His number dates to June or July 1915 and indicates that he was an original member of the 11th (Gwent) Battalion, SWB.  His number probably appeared on his service papers as 11/22554.  Interesting that in the original photo his number is listed as 22547, although others sources -  SDGW, CWGC and MIC - list 22554.

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Born 1899 Birkdale, Southport, Lancs. Second youngest of five children [Margaret b. 1891, Liverpool. Christina b. 1893, Liverpool. George b. 1896, Liverpool and Harold b. 1900, Birkdale] born to  Henry [b. 1867, Liverpool] and Margaret [b. 1869, Liverpool]. The 1901 census records the family living at 9 Lloyds Sidings, Birkdale, Liverpool. His father’s employment is recorded as “General Labourer”.
Here is a link to a Google Earth overlain with a 1907 map showing the approximate position of his childhood home. Using the map and looking at Street View, the site is occupied by houses which certainly occupy the same footprint – the area much developed and the road re-named Lynton Drive, the house being number 30. I am uncertain if they are of the period – even if they have heavily rebuilt, they look a bit up-market for a general labourer with five children.
Click on the picture below for a larger view but it may take a few minutes as it’s a large photo.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits/6350098293/in/photostream]

comment.author: 69798423@N03
comment._content:
Walter landed in France on 4th December 1915 in conjunction with the landing of the 10th and 11th SWB landing at Le Harve with the 38th (Welsh) Division.

SDGW Info:

Name: Walter Williams
Birth Place: Birkdale, Lancs
Death Date: 10 Jul 1916
Death Location: France & Flanders 
Enlistment Location: Liverpool
Rank: L/Corporal
Regiment: South Wales Borderers
Battalion: 11th Battalion
Number: 22554
Type of Casualty: Killed in action
Theatre of War: Western European Theatre
